alert.note: Alert for James City (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 02 at 3:51AM EDT until September 02 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...James City County along the tidal James River. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Shallow flooding is possible in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. JAMES RIVER AT SCOTLAND/JAMESTOWN VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.0 FT, MODERATE 4.5 FT, MAJOR 5.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/03 PM 3.7 1.5 1.1 1 NONE 03/03 AM 3.4 1.2 1.1 1 NONE 03/03 PM 3.5 1.3 0.9 1 NONE 04/03 AM 2.8 0.6 0.7 1 NONE 04/04 PM 3.0 0.8 0.5 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
